full_text: Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 755 Filed 08/10/22 Page 116 of 262 LC8VMAX4 Rodgers - direct 1 A. That's a copy of my logbook. 2 Q. Did you review this before coming to testify here today to make sure that this exhibit is an accurate copy of your logbook? 3 4 A. Yes, I did. 5 6 Q. Was each entry in this logbook made at or near the time of the flight reflected in each row? 7 8 A. Yes, it would have been made at the time that flight was over, probably within 30 minutes of the passengers leaving. 9 10 Q. Did you keep these records in the course of your regularly conducted activity as a pilot? 11 12 A. Yes. 13 Q. And was maintaining this logbook a regular practice of that activity? 14 15 A. Yes. 16 MS. COMEY: Your Honor, the government offers Exhibit 662 under seal; and a redacted version, 662-R, for the public. 17 18 The sealing is for witness and third-party reasons. 19 MR. EVERDELL: No objection. 20 THE COURT: All right. 662 is admitted under seal for the reasons indicated. 662-R is admitted, which is a redacted version. 21 22 (Government's Exhibits 662, 662-R received in evidence) 23 24 MS. COMEY: Thank you, your Honor. 25 SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00013394

Was each entry in this logbook made at or near the time of the flight reflected in each row? 7 8 A. Yes, it would have been made at the time that flight was over, probably within 30 minutes of the passengers leaving. 9 10 Q. Did you keep these records in the course of your regularly conducted activity as a pilot? 11 12 A. Yes. 13 Q. And was maintaining this logbook a regular practice of that activity? 14 15 A. Yes. 16 MS. COMEY: Your Honor, the government offers Exhibit 662 under seal; and a redacted version, 662-R, for the public. 17 18 The sealing is for witness and third-party reasons. 19 MR. EVERDELL: No objection. 20 THE COURT: All right. 662 is admitted under seal for the reasons indicated. 662-R is admitted, which is a redacted version. 21 22 (Government's Exhibits 662, 662-R received in evidence) 23 24 MS.
